New Records: Atlanta Braves scored four times in the 10th inning to beat the Minnesota Twins 8-6
The most combined letters in the last names of a starting pitching matchup (28 letters) between Spencer Schwellenbach and Simeon Woods Richardson
Key Match Events: The Braves' four-run 10th inning rally, including Matt Olson's game-winning grounder and Ram√≥n Laureano's two-run double
Jhoan Duran allowed four runs (three earned) and four hits in the loss
Raisel Iglesias blew a save after allowing Trevor Larnach's game-tying RBI double
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves led 4-0 before the Twins' late rally
Michael Harris returned to the starting lineup after being injured by a pitch on Sunday
Marcell Ozuna had two hits, including a two-run double in the fifth inning and now has 98 RBIs, third in the majors
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota Twins starting pitcher Simeon Woods Richardson allowed five hits and three walks in 4 2/3 innings
RHP Joe Ryan was transferred to the 60-day injured list with a right shoulder strain
LHP Chris Sale will start Wednesday's series finale for the Braves
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves' win improved their record to 8-6 in the 10-game stretch
The Twins' three-run seventh inning included RBI doubles by Trevor Larnach and Edouard Julien and an RBI single by Matt Wallner
The game marked the fourth time in 23 starts that Woods Richardson allowed four runs or more
